page.title: 11Transport.
page.content: Three buses pass through our village every weekday from the south end of the island and go to Lerwick. Most people have a car and some have two. A car is essential to get to the shops, as we don't have a shop in Quarff. Some of us go to school in a taxi because we have a dangerous main road to cross. On a farm or croft we have tractors and two wheeler and three wheeler motorbikes. The bikes are used for hill work. Tractors and trailers are used to take home the peats. In the past we used to take them home with a horse and cart. All the children in our school have a pedal bicycle. A policeman comes to give us road safety lessons, after which we take a Cycling Proficiency Test. Each one who passes receives a certificate and a badge. MALCOLM JAMIESON.
